result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robin John Grainger

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robin John Grainger in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Robin John Grainger.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense motion to reduce defendant's JusticePoint supervision. No objection from the state. Court ordered defendant Justice Point to be lowered to SUPERVISION Level 3. Defense requests a resolution date. Court adjourns case for a plea and sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail, filed.

Defendant Robin John Grainger appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Robin John Grainger.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11. Defense motion on bail, state argues, court denied motion on bail.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, appear by video. Defendant Robin John Grainger not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a status. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robin John Grainger not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant needs to be evaluated to determine his eligibility. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Francis D.

Defendant Robin John Grainger in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Robin John Grainger in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robin John Grainger appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
